alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 3:10PM AKST until February 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...NEXT WEATHER FRONT WITH OVERRUNNING SNOW TO IMPACT SOUTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY... .Moist warm air overrunning the northern and central panhandle, with cooler air in place, will result in snow accumulating with 4 to 8 inches primarily over 12 hour period. Most favorable locations for the better snowfall accumulations are over the Icy Strait Corridor to Juneau. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Alaska. * WHEN...From 6 PM Tuesday to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may be wet and difficult to manage Wednesday as temperatures are expected to warm and mix rain into the precipitation. Anticipated higher snowfall rates late Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
